titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Columbia River Basin Dam Oversized Photographs 1951-1968
Columbia River Basin Dam Oversized Photographs

repository.corpname: Washington State University Libraries, Manuscripts, Archives and Special Collections

did.unittitle: Columbia River Basin Dam Oversized Photographs

physdesc.dimensions: With the exception of four of the five Dworshak Dam images, all images are approximately 20"x16". The remaining four Dworshak images are approximately 9"x7".

did.abstract: Need for both electric power and agricultural water supply resulted in multiple dams being placed on rivers in the Columbia River drainage basin in the mid 20th century. The collection consists of a number of photos taken over the period of the construction of several dams, from very early stages to near completion.
did.physloc: (FOR MASC USE) All images are located in oversize storage cabinets.

bioghist.p: Need for both electric power and agricultural water supply resulted in multiple dams being placed on rivers in the Columbia River drainage basin in the mid 20th century. These included the Dworshak Dam (Clearwater North Fork, initial construction running from 1966-1972), Ice Harbor Dam (Snake River, 1955-1961), and the Little Goose Dam (Snake River, 1963-1970), among many others.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of a number of photos taken over the period of the construction of several dams, from very early stages to near completion.

arrangement.p: The collection is organized by dam, with each of the three most commonly depicted dams (Dworshak, Ice Harbor, Little Goose) in their own folders, and the remaining five images of four other dams placed in a fourth folder.

accessrestrict.p: This collection is open and available for research use.

prefercite.p: [Item Description] Columbia River Basin Dam Photographs, 1951-1968 (PC 129)
Manuscripts, Archives, and Special Collections, Washington State University Libraries, Pullman, WA.

acqinfo.p: This collection was received at WSU Libraries' Manuscripts, Archives, and Special Collections prior to 2009 from an unknown source; nothing is known about its provenance.

processinfo.p: This collection was processed by University Archivist Mark O'English in July, 2009.

controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed under the following headings in the online catalog. Researchers desiring materials about related topics, persons, or places should search the catalog using these headings.
